title: Help identifying the font used on the Brisan Carriages logo.
content:
Hi,

Wondering if someone can help me out with identifying a font. I tried what the font and i've had a good look online. No luck.

The font I need the name of is within the Brisan Carriages logo at [www.brisancarriages.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.brisancarriages.co.uk/ "www.brisancarriages.co.uk") and the "Carriages" font. I think it would be a script font.

Thanks so much

Lee

Font: 

 Storefront 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: LeeM

comments.content:
You could get pretty close to \_BRISAN\_ with PAG Bankas

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PAGBankasAsBrisanLogoTypophile114879_3486.jpg)
  
with the bottom of the \_S\_ swept to the left.  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BrisanLogoTypophile114879b_5682.jpg)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/")  
As for \_Carriages\_ the g and s, and perhaps other letters are significantly modified, but you could use a script like Amazone which has similar \_r\_ and \_s\_ [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/amazone/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/amazone/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/amazone/") or pick a script with all letters but \_s\_ such as Commercial Script [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Commercial+Script/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Commercial+Script/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Commercial+Script/fonts/")  
Palace Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/palace-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/palace-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/palace-script/")  
or Sackers Italian Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers-italian-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers-italian-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers-italian-script/")  
I trust that another font detective will post something closer for the script, or perhaps even an exact match.  
Don

Hi Don,

Thanks for the reply. Appreciate it.

I did think Carriages had been modified a lot which is probably why it didn't show up on "what the font." Thanks for the suggested scrip fonts I'll have a close look at each one.

What's hard is my client wants to use the font for the word "prestige" and I'm not sure if picking another scrip font would suffice. I may have to do some modifications as well I'm thinking.

Thanks again,  
Lee

I found this image. It's a bit easier to see, it still didn't show up on what the font though.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933im_/http:/typophile.com/files/arria_3745.jpg)

The script is [Storefront](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/storefront-pro) by Sudtipos Ale Paul using some stylistic alternates: / [g](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/storefront-pro/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/525787/633) and / [s](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/storefront-pro/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/525787/919)
Thanks for the reply and for identifying the font. I really appreciate it.
